primarySegments.name: Busy Urban Professionals
primarySegments.description: Young, career-focused individuals living in cities who own dogs but struggle to find time for regular walks.

demographics: Urban dwellers in apartments or small homes
psychographics: Sees pets as important family members
problemsNeeds: Lack of time for regular dog walks due to long work hours
Guilt about leaving dog alone for extended periods
Need for reliable, trustworthy dog walkers
behaviors: Frequently use on-demand services and apps
Likely to book recurring walks on a set schedule
Willing to pay premium for convenience and quality service

primarySegments.name: Active Empty Nesters
primarySegments.description: Older adults with more free time who want to maintain an active lifestyle but sometimes need help walking their dogs.

problemsNeeds: Occasional need for dog walking due to travel or social engagements
Physical limitations that sometimes prevent long walks
Desire for socialization for their dogs
behaviors: May use app less frequently but for longer durations
Likely to develop relationships with specific walkers
Interested in detailed reports about their dog's activities

primarySegments.name: Tech-Savvy Pet Parents
primarySegments.description: Younger dog owners who embrace technology and prioritize their pets' care and well-being.

demographics: Mix of urban and suburban locations
psychographics: Highly engaged in pet care and training
problemsNeeds: Desire for on-demand services that fit unpredictable schedules
Interest in tracking dog's activity and health data
Need for socialization and exercise for high-energy dogs
behaviors: Frequent app usage, often booking last-minute walks
Likely to use additional features like GPS tracking or photo updates
May act as both dog owners and dog walkers on the platform

excludedSegments.name: Rural Dog Owners
excludedSegments.reason: This segment typically has ample space for dogs to roam and exercise, reducing the need for dedicated dog walking services. The lower population density in rural areas also makes it challenging to maintain a consistent supply of dog walkers, making the service less viable in these regions.
